intro: Spilanthes orizabaensis, commonly known as the Mexican toothache plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow-orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is known for its strong, pungent odor and has been traditionally used in folk medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
